questions.question: What is the fundamental goal of machine learning?

options.A: To write efficient computer programs.
options.B: To enable computers to learn from data without being explicitly programmed.
options.C: To create static models based on fixed rules.
options.D: To visualize large datasets.

questions.question: Which of the following is a type of supervised learning?

options.A: Clustering
options.B: Dimensionality Reduction
options.C: Regression
options.D: Reinforcement Learning

questions.question: In supervised learning, what is the role of labeled data?

options.A: It is used only for model evaluation.
options.B: It consists of input features without corresponding output targets.
options.C: It provides the correct output targets for the input features, allowing the model to learn the mapping between them.
options.D: It is used for unsupervised learning tasks.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common algorithm for classification tasks?

options.A: Linear Regression
options.B: K-Means Clustering
options.C: Support Vector Machines (SVM)
options.D: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)

questions.question: Which of the following is a common algorithm for regression tasks?

options.A: Logistic Regression
options.B: Decision Trees
options.C: Apriori Algorithm
options.D: Linear Regression

questions.question: What is unsupervised learning?

options.A: Learning from labeled data to predict future outcomes.
options.B: Learning patterns and structures from unlabeled data.
options.C: Learning through trial and error with a reward system.
options.D: Learning to classify data into predefined categories.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common unsupervised learning algorithm?

options.A: Naive Bayes
options.B: Random Forest
options.C: K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN)
options.D: K-Means Clustering

questions.question: What is reinforcement learning?

options.A: Learning from labeled data.
options.B: Learning patterns from unlabeled data.
options.C: Learning through interactions with an environment by receiving rewards or penalties for actions.
options.D: Learning to classify data based on similarity.

questions.question: What is the purpose of splitting a dataset into training and testing sets?

options.A: To increase the size of the dataset.
options.B: To train the model on all the data.
options.C: To evaluate the performance of the trained model on unseen data.
options.D: To visualize the data more effectively.

questions.question: What is overfitting in machine learning?

options.A: When a model performs poorly on the training data.
options.B: When a model learns the training data too well, including the noise, and performs poorly on unseen data.
options.C: When a model generalizes well to unseen data.
options.D: When the training data is insufficient.

questions.question: Which of the following techniques can help to reduce overfitting?

options.A: Increasing the complexity of the model.
options.B: Training the model for a longer time.
options.C: Regularization
options.D: Using more features.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a confusion matrix in classification?

options.A: To visualize the distribution of data points.
options.B: To evaluate the performance of a classification model by showing the counts of true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives.
options.C: To identify clusters in the data.
options.D: To reduce the dimensionality of the data.

questions.question: What is precision in the context of classification?

options.A: The proportion of actual positives that were correctly identified.
options.B: The proportion of predicted positives that were actually positive.
options.C: The overall accuracy of the model.
options.D: The ability of the model to find all the positive instances.

questions.question: What is recall (sensitivity) in the context of classification?

options.A: The proportion of predicted positives that were actually positive.
options.B: The overall accuracy of the model.
options.C: The proportion of actual positives that were correctly identified.
options.D: The proportion of actual negatives that were correctly identified.

questions.question: What is the F1-score?

options.A: A simple average of precision and recall.
options.B: The weighted average of true positives and true negatives.
options.C: The harmonic mean of precision and recall.
options.D: Another name for accuracy.

questions.question: What is the role of features in a machine learning model?

options.A: They are the predicted outputs of the model.
options.B: They are the input variables used by the model to make predictions.
options.C: They are the parameters that the model learns during training.
options.D: They are used only for evaluating the model.

questions.question: What is feature scaling and why is it often important?

options.A: It is the process of selecting the most important features; it is important for model interpretability.
options.B: It is the process of transforming features to have a similar scale; it is important for algorithms sensitive to feature magnitude.
options.C: It is the process of creating new features; it is important for improving model accuracy.
options.D: It is the process of encoding categorical features into numerical form; it is important for all machine learning algorithms.

questions.question: What is the bias-variance tradeoff?

options.A: The tradeoff between model complexity and training time.
options.B: The tradeoff between the amount of data used for training and testing.
options.C: The tradeoff between underfitting (high bias) and overfitting (high variance).
options.D: The tradeoff between precision and recall.

questions.question: What is the purpose of hyperparameter tuning?

options.A: To train the model on more data.
options.B: To select the optimal values for the parameters that the model learns from the data.
options.C: To select the optimal values for the parameters that are set before training the model.
options.D: To evaluate the performance of the model on the testing set.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common technique for hyperparameter tuning?

options.A: Gradient descent
options.B: Principal Component Analysis (PCA)
options.C: Grid search
options.D: K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN)
